Seeking a systematic examination or an in-depth examination of a specific subject, the field of children's youth literature is of interest to us.

Recently, the latest work of writer Iñaki Zubeldia has been published, which explores child and youth literature. The book's cover reads "Haur literature under examination 2" and is a follow-up to the examination conducted six years ago. "It's not a treatise on child literature, nor is it a thorough and comprehensive examination of the subject. Rather, they are incursions into the realm of child and youth literature", as the author has explained. "Child literature, the profession of writer, the importance of libraries, new ways of promoting literature... they are examined and some reflections, interviews, and critical opinions are offered".

Iñaki Zubeldia himself has stated, "I am not an expert or erudite in children's literature, but rather one who tries and when I have seen things poorly, I have explained them, always trying to clearly state my reasons and my perspective and offering clear examples. I offer an external perspective on children's literature and examine authors outside the official canon - 'other authors' is what I call them, somewhat marginalized and in some cases 'ignored' by official currents".

The authors of the work have examined various topics with these aims in mind. The book will open with a text written in memory of Joxantonio Ormazabal, and then present eleven studies and reflections: the evolution of Basque child and youth literature, the defense of child literature, the importance of child libraries, the examination of the work of certain authors, and interviews with them ...
